info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 9:51AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 1015 AM MDT... At 951 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Wray, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 252 and 269. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
